item.description:
COLD WATER WORKSHOP... On & off the water

NSPN (North Shore Paddlers Network) EVENT: www.NSPN.org

If you are someone interested in transitioning to ocean paddling in COLD weather, I have opened up 10 spots to club members for those interested in moving to the next level of paddling.

You must own your own Sea Kayak, spray skirt, paddle, neoprene cold water gloves and proper insulating undergarments to wear under your a dry suit. Be sure to contact me or Bob as to your skill level as well. Some experience in salt water is mandatory as this is not an introduction to sea kayaking, it's an introduction to COLD WATER Sea Kayaking.

SEE LINK: http://nesmallcraft.com/links/  and navigate to discussion on "Hands & Feet" in the General forum.

POST YOUR INTEREST HERE then contact me (Doug Mogill) to discuss your attendance to this event.

DESCRIPTION: Scott Camlin and Suz Hutchinson (Kokatat Rep) will be conducting the yearly NSPN cold water event this year on Nov. 6.

This will be a workshop done as a "learning on the go" style paddle as was done for the Spring CAM (Common Adventure Model) workshops on the water.

• Review of cold water physiology and clothing; recognizing hypothermia.

• Dunk tests

• Rescues and tows (cold water version of last spring)

• Group scenarios; CAM/leadership issues related to cold water

• Warm up practice (on-water and on-shore)

• Indoors debrief (if we can find a place nearby to where we will be paddling.)

Our launch LOCATION will be planned as we get closer to the event. UPDATES can only be found on the NSPN forum.

It will depend on wind/weather conditions. Most likely we will plan this near/on Cape Ann or perhaps Ipswich. Any updates to the trip will be posted to the NSPN website (www.NSPN.org) and the evening before we will post the location depending on the weather.

More information will also be posted on the NSPN calendar. The paddling will be within level 2 guidelines on NSPN. We will have NSPN support paddlers (one per 3-4 participants) so that we will not need to limit participants.

If you are interested in using a drysuit for the day, Suz will bring Kokatat demo suits. They will be available on a first come/first serve basis. Please contact me (Doug) if you need to reserve a suit.


YOU MUST RSVP HERE FIRST: Contact Doug or Bob, then once registered here, you will need to resister on the NSPN forum. When rsvp'ing on the NSPN Forum you will need to let Suz know if you are hoping to use a drysuit and what size you think you are so she can make NOTE: http://www.kokatat.com/sizing_mens.asp http://www.kokatat.c...zing_womens.asp

If planning to use a drysuit, please bring form fitting fleece to wear underneath, wool/fleece socks and closed shoes that can be worn OVER the drysuit sock and your socks. Fleece jackets are too bulky to go underneath a drysuit. Please bring any gloves/hoods/hats/shoes that you have that are extra so that if someone else is missing an article of clothing, they can borrow.

FIRST: RSVP - Doug@NEBM.net (or) rylevine@comcast.net Please include CWW in the subject line for either Doug or Bob. Thanks!

IMPORTANT NOTE: All updates will be posted on the NSPN Forum so once you are signed up and confirmed, final updates such as times, location etc will be posted there.

Doug
item.name: NSPN Introduction to COLD WATER ..... WORKSHOP
